00040 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Mathutils_doc,
00041 "This module provides access to matrices, eulers, quaternions and vectors."
00042 );
00043 static int mathutils_array_parse_fast(float *array,
00044                                       int size,
00045                                       PyObject *value_fast,
00046                                       const char *error_prefix)
00047 {
00048     PyObject *item;
00049 
00050     int i;
00051 
00052     i = size;
00053     do {
00054         i--;
00055         if (((array[i] = PyFloat_AsDouble((item = PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value_fast, i)))) == -1.0f) &&
00056             PyErr_Occurred())
00057         {
00058             PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00059                          "%.200s: sequence index %d expected a number, "
00060                          "found '%.200s' type, ",
00061                          error_prefix, i, Py_TYPE(item)->tp_name);
00062             Py_DECREF(value_fast);
00063             return -1;
00064         }
00065     } while (i);
00066 
00067     Py_XDECREF(value_fast);
00068     return size;
00069 }
00070 
00071 /* helper functionm returns length of the 'value', -1 on error */
00072 int mathutils_array_parse(float *array, int array_min, int array_max, PyObject *value, const char *error_prefix)
00073 {
00074     int size;
00075 
00076 #if 1 /* approx 6x speedup for mathutils types */
00077 
00078     if ((size = VectorObject_Check(value)     ? ((VectorObject *)value)->size : 0) ||
00079         (size = EulerObject_Check(value)      ? 3 : 0) ||
00080         (size = QuaternionObject_Check(value) ? 4 : 0) ||
00081         (size = ColorObject_Check(value)      ? 3 : 0))
00082     {
00083         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((BaseMathObject *)value) == -1) {
00084             return -1;
00085         }
00086 
00087         if (size > array_max || size < array_min) {
00088             if (array_max == array_min) {
00089                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00090                              "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected %d",
00091                              error_prefix, size, array_max);
00092             }
00093             else {
00094                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00095                              "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected [%d - %d]",
00096                              error_prefix, size, array_min, array_max);
00097             }
00098             return -1;
00099         }
00100 
00101         memcpy(array, ((BaseMathObject *)value)->data, size * sizeof(float));
00102         return size;
00103     }
00104     else
00105 #endif
00106     {
00107         PyObject *value_fast = NULL;
00108 
00109         /* non list/tuple cases */
00110         if (!(value_fast = PySequence_Fast(value, error_prefix))) {
00111             /* PySequence_Fast sets the error */
00112             return -1;
00113         }
00114 
00115         size = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(value_fast);
00116 
00117         if (size > array_max || size < array_min) {
00118             if (array_max == array_min) {
00119                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00120                              "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected %d",
00121                              error_prefix, size, array_max);
00122             }
00123             else {
00124                 PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00125                              "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected [%d - %d]",
00126                              error_prefix, size, array_min, array_max);
00127             }
00128             Py_DECREF(value_fast);
00129             return -1;
00130         }
00131 
00132         return mathutils_array_parse_fast(array, size, value_fast, error_prefix);
00133     }
00134 }
00135 
00136 int mathutils_array_parse_alloc(float **array, int array_min, PyObject *value, const char *error_prefix)
00137 {
00138     int size;
00139 
00140 #if 1 /* approx 6x speedup for mathutils types */
00141 
00142     if ((size = VectorObject_Check(value)     ? ((VectorObject *)value)->size : 0) ||
00143         (size = EulerObject_Check(value)      ? 3 : 0) ||
00144         (size = QuaternionObject_Check(value) ? 4 : 0) ||
00145         (size = ColorObject_Check(value)      ? 3 : 0))
00146     {
00147         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((BaseMathObject *)value) == -1) {
00148             return -1;
00149         }
00150 
00151         if (size < array_min) {
00152             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00153                          "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected > %d",
00154                          error_prefix, size, array_min);
00155             return -1;
00156         }
00157         
00158         *array = PyMem_Malloc(size * sizeof(float));
00159         memcpy(*array, ((BaseMathObject *)value)->data, size * sizeof(float));
00160         return size;
00161     }
00162     else
00163 #endif
00164     {
00165         PyObject *value_fast = NULL;
00166         // *array = NULL;
00167 
00168         /* non list/tuple cases */
00169         if (!(value_fast = PySequence_Fast(value, error_prefix))) {
00170             /* PySequence_Fast sets the error */
00171             return -1;
00172         }
00173 
00174         size = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(value_fast);
00175 
00176         if (size < array_min) {
00177             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00178                          "%.200s: sequence size is %d, expected > %d",
00179                          error_prefix, size, array_min);
00180             return -1;
00181         }
00182 
00183         *array = PyMem_Malloc(size * sizeof(float));
00184 
00185         return mathutils_array_parse_fast(*array, size, value_fast, error_prefix);
00186     }
00187 }
00188 
00189 /* parse an array of vectors */
00190 int mathutils_array_parse_alloc_v(float **array, int array_dim, PyObject *value, const char *error_prefix)
00191 {
00192     PyObject *value_fast = NULL;
00193     int i, size;
00194 
00195     /* non list/tuple cases */
00196     if (!(value_fast = PySequence_Fast(value, error_prefix))) {
00197         /* PySequence_Fast sets the error */
00198         return -1;
00199     }
00200 
00201     size = PySequence_Fast_GET_SIZE(value_fast);
00202 
00203     if (size != 0) {
00204         float *fp;
00205 
00206         fp = *array = PyMem_Malloc(size * array_dim * sizeof(float));
00207 
00208         for (i = 0; i < size; i++, fp += array_dim) {
00209             PyObject *item = PySequence_Fast_GET_ITEM(value, i);
00210 
00211             if (mathutils_array_parse(fp, array_dim, array_dim, item, error_prefix) == -1) {
00212                 PyMem_Free(*array);
00213                 *array = NULL;
00214                 size = -1;
00215                 break;
00216             }
00217         }
00218     }
00219 
00220     Py_DECREF(value_fast);
00221     return size;
00222 }
00223 
00224 int mathutils_any_to_rotmat(float rmat[3][3], PyObject *value, const char *error_prefix)
00225 {
00226     if (EulerObject_Check(value)) {
00227         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((BaseMathObject *)value) == -1) {
00228             return -1;
00229         }
00230         else {
00231             eulO_to_mat3(rmat, ((EulerObject *)value)->eul, ((EulerObject *)value)->order);
00232             return 0;
00233         }
00234     }
00235     else if (QuaternionObject_Check(value)) {
00236         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((BaseMathObject *)value) == -1) {
00237             return -1;
00238         }
00239         else {
00240             float tquat[4];
00241             normalize_qt_qt(tquat, ((QuaternionObject *)value)->quat);
00242             quat_to_mat3(rmat, tquat);
00243             return 0;
00244         }
00245     }
00246     else if (MatrixObject_Check(value)) {
00247         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((BaseMathObject *)value) == -1) {
00248             return -1;
00249         }
00250         else if (((MatrixObject *)value)->num_row < 3 || ((MatrixObject *)value)->num_col < 3) {
00251             PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError,
00252                          "%.200s: matrix must have minimum 3x3 dimensions",
00253                          error_prefix);
00254             return -1;
00255         }
00256         else {
00257             matrix_as_3x3(rmat, (MatrixObject *)value);
00258             normalize_m3(rmat);
00259             return 0;
00260         }
00261     }
00262     else {
00263         PyErr_Format(PyExc_TypeError,
00264                      "%.200s: expected a Euler, Quaternion or Matrix type, "
00265                      "found %.200s", error_prefix, Py_TYPE(value)->tp_name);
00266         return -1;
00267     }
00268 }

00274 /* Utility functions */
00275 
00276 // LomontRRDCompare4, Ever Faster Float Comparisons by Randy Dillon
00277 #define SIGNMASK(i) (-(int)(((unsigned int)(i)) >> 31))
00278 
00279 int EXPP_FloatsAreEqual(float af, float bf, int maxDiff)
00280 {
00281     /* solid, fast routine across all platforms
00282      * with constant time behavior */
00283     int ai = *(int *)(&af);
00284     int bi = *(int *)(&bf);
00285     int test = SIGNMASK(ai ^ bi);
00286     int diff, v1, v2;
00287 
00288     assert((0 == test) || (0xFFFFFFFF == test));
00289     diff = (ai ^ (test & 0x7fffffff)) - bi;
00290     v1 = maxDiff + diff;
00291     v2 = maxDiff - diff;
00292     return (v1 | v2) >= 0;
00293 }
00294 
00295 /*---------------------- EXPP_VectorsAreEqual -------------------------
00296  * Builds on EXPP_FloatsAreEqual to test vectors */
00297 int EXPP_VectorsAreEqual(float *vecA, float *vecB, int size, int floatSteps)
00298 {
00299     int x;
00300     for (x = 0; x < size; x++) {
00301         if (EXPP_FloatsAreEqual(vecA[x], vecB[x], floatSteps) == 0)
00302             return 0;
00303     }
00304     return 1;
00305 }
00306 
00307 /* dynstr as python string utility funcions, frees 'ds'! */
00308 PyObject *mathutils_dynstr_to_py(struct DynStr *ds)
00309 {
00310     const int ds_len = BLI_dynstr_get_len(ds); /* space for \0 */
00311     char *ds_buf     = PyMem_Malloc(ds_len + 1);
00312     PyObject *ret;
00313     BLI_dynstr_get_cstring_ex(ds, ds_buf);
00314     BLI_dynstr_free(ds);
00315     ret = PyUnicode_FromStringAndSize(ds_buf, ds_len);
00316     PyMem_Free(ds_buf);
00317     return ret;
00318 }

00320 /* silly function, we dont use arg. just check its compatible with __deepcopy__ */
00321 int mathutils_deepcopy_args_check(PyObject *args)
00322 {
00323     PyObject *dummy_pydict;
00324     return PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|O!:__deepcopy__", &PyDict_Type, &dummy_pydict) != 0;
00325 }
00326 
00327 /* Mathutils Callbacks */
00328 
00329 /* for mathutils internal use only, eventually should re-alloc but to start with we only have a few users */
00330 #define MATHUTILS_TOT_CB 10
00331 static Mathutils_Callback *mathutils_callbacks[MATHUTILS_TOT_CB] = {NULL};
00332 
00333 unsigned char Mathutils_RegisterCallback(Mathutils_Callback *cb)
00334 {
00335     unsigned char i;
00336     
00337     /* find the first free slot */
00338     for (i = 0; mathutils_callbacks[i]; i++) {
00339         if (mathutils_callbacks[i] == cb) /* already registered? */
00340             return i;
00341     }
00342 
00343     BLI_assert(i + 1 < MATHUTILS_TOT_CB);
00344 
00345     mathutils_callbacks[i] = cb;
00346     return i;
00347 }
00348 
00349 /* use macros to check for NULL */
00350 int _BaseMathObject_ReadCallback(BaseMathObject *self)
00351 {
00352     Mathutils_Callback *cb = mathutils_callbacks[self->cb_type];
00353     if (LIKELY(cb->get(self, self->cb_subtype) != -1)) {
00354         return 0;
00355     }
00356 
00357     if (!PyErr_Occurred()) {
00358         PyErr_Format(PyExc_RuntimeError,
00359                      "%s read, user has become invalid",
00360                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name);
00361     }
00362     return -1;
00363 }
00364 
00365 int _BaseMathObject_WriteCallback(BaseMathObject *self)
00366 {
00367     Mathutils_Callback *cb = mathutils_callbacks[self->cb_type];
00368     if (LIKELY(cb->set(self, self->cb_subtype) != -1)) {
00369         return 0;
00370     }
00371 
00372     if (!PyErr_Occurred()) {
00373         PyErr_Format(PyExc_RuntimeError,
00374                      "%s write, user has become invalid",
00375                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name);
00376     }
00377     return -1;
00378 }
00379 
00380 int _BaseMathObject_ReadIndexCallback(BaseMathObject *self, int index)
00381 {
00382     Mathutils_Callback *cb = mathutils_callbacks[self->cb_type];
00383     if (LIKELY(cb->get_index(self, self->cb_subtype, index) != -1)) {
00384         return 0;
00385     }
00386 
00387     if (!PyErr_Occurred()) {
00388         PyErr_Format(PyExc_RuntimeError,
00389                      "%s read index, user has become invalid",
00390                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name);
00391     }
00392     return -1;
00393 }
00394 
00395 int _BaseMathObject_WriteIndexCallback(BaseMathObject *self, int index)
00396 {
00397     Mathutils_Callback *cb = mathutils_callbacks[self->cb_type];
00398     if (LIKELY(cb->set_index(self, self->cb_subtype, index) != -1)) {
00399         return 0;
00400     }
00401 
00402     if (!PyErr_Occurred()) {
00403         PyErr_Format(PyExc_RuntimeError,
00404                      "%s write index, user has become invalid",
00405                      Py_TYPE(self)->tp_name);
00406     }
00407     return -1;
00408 }

00410 /* BaseMathObject generic functions for all mathutils types */
00411 char BaseMathObject_owner_doc[] = "The item this is wrapping or None  (read-only).";
00412 PyObject *BaseMathObject_owner_get(BaseMathObject *self, void *UNUSED(closure))
00413 {
00414     PyObject *ret = self->cb_user ? self->cb_user : Py_None;
00415     Py_INCREF(ret);
00416     return ret;
00417 }
00418 
00419 char BaseMathObject_is_wrapped_doc[] = "True when this object wraps external data (read-only).\n\n:type: boolean";
00420 PyObject *BaseMathObject_is_wrapped_get(BaseMathObject *self, void *UNUSED(closure))
00421 {
00422     return PyBool_FromLong((self->wrapped == Py_WRAP) ? 1 : 0);
00423 }
00424 
00425 int BaseMathObject_traverse(BaseMathObject *self, visitproc visit, void *arg)
00426 {
00427     Py_VISIT(self->cb_user);
00428     return 0;
00429 }
00430 
00431 int BaseMathObject_clear(BaseMathObject *self)
00432 {
00433     Py_CLEAR(self->cb_user);
00434     return 0;
00435 }
00436 
00437 void BaseMathObject_dealloc(BaseMathObject *self)
00438 {
00439     /* only free non wrapped */
00440     if (self->wrapped != Py_WRAP) {
00441         PyMem_Free(self->data);
00442     }
00443 
00444     if (self->cb_user) {
00445         PyObject_GC_UnTrack(self);
00446         BaseMathObject_clear(self);
00447     }
00448 
00449     Py_TYPE(self)->tp_free(self); // PyObject_DEL(self); // breaks subtypes
00450 }

00453 static struct PyMethodDef M_Mathutils_methods[] = {
00454     {NULL, NULL, 0, NULL}
00455 };
00456 
00457 static struct PyModuleDef M_Mathutils_module_def = {
00458     PyModuleDef_HEAD_INIT,
00459     "mathutils",  /* m_name */
00460     M_Mathutils_doc,  /* m_doc */
00461     0,  /* m_size */
00462     M_Mathutils_methods,  /* m_methods */
00463     NULL,  /* m_reload */
00464     NULL,  /* m_traverse */
00465     NULL,  /* m_clear */
00466     NULL,  /* m_free */
00467 };

00469 PyMODINIT_FUNC PyInit_mathutils(void)
00470 {
00471     PyObject *mod;
00472     PyObject *submodule;
00473     PyObject *sys_modules = PyThreadState_GET()->interp->modules;
00474 
00475     if (PyType_Ready(&vector_Type) < 0)
00476         return NULL;
00477     if (PyType_Ready(&matrix_Type) < 0)
00478         return NULL;
00479     if (PyType_Ready(&matrix_access_Type) < 0)
00480         return NULL;
00481     if (PyType_Ready(&euler_Type) < 0)
00482         return NULL;
00483     if (PyType_Ready(&quaternion_Type) < 0)
00484         return NULL;
00485     if (PyType_Ready(&color_Type) < 0)
00486         return NULL;
00487 
00488     mod = PyModule_Create(&M_Mathutils_module_def);
00489     
00490     /* each type has its own new() function */
00491     PyModule_AddObject(mod, vector_Type.tp_name,     (PyObject *)&vector_Type);
00492     PyModule_AddObject(mod, matrix_Type.tp_name,     (PyObject *)&matrix_Type);
00493     PyModule_AddObject(mod, euler_Type.tp_name,      (PyObject *)&euler_Type);
00494     PyModule_AddObject(mod, quaternion_Type.tp_name, (PyObject *)&quaternion_Type);
00495     PyModule_AddObject(mod, color_Type.tp_name,      (PyObject *)&color_Type);
00496     
00497     /* submodule */
00498     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "geometry",       (submodule = PyInit_mathutils_geometry()));
00499     /* XXX, python doesnt do imports with this usefully yet
00500      * 'from mathutils.geometry import PolyFill'
00501      * ...fails without this. */
00502     PyDict_SetItemString(sys_modules, PyModule_GetName(submodule), submodule);
00503     Py_INCREF(submodule);
00504 
00505     /* Noise submodule */
00506     PyModule_AddObject(mod, "noise", (submodule = PyInit_mathutils_noise()));
00507     PyDict_SetItemString(sys_modules, PyModule_GetName(submodule), submodule);
00508     Py_INCREF(submodule);
00509 
00510     mathutils_matrix_row_cb_index = Mathutils_RegisterCallback(&mathutils_matrix_row_cb);
00511     mathutils_matrix_col_cb_index = Mathutils_RegisterCallback(&mathutils_matrix_col_cb);
00512     mathutils_matrix_translation_cb_index = Mathutils_RegisterCallback(&mathutils_matrix_translation_cb);
00513 
00514     return mod;
00515 }
